notesStmt.note: Slight damage to edges and tie.
Manuscript description based on Margoliouth, G.: Catalogue of the Hebrew and Samaritan Manuscripts in the British Museum, London 1965.

layoutDesc.layout: Columns: 21; ruled lines: 19; written lines: 19; Uniform layout. Ruling by hard point, membrane by membrane. Visible pricking. Hair side and flesh side of membranes distinguishable. Three tagin on שעטנזגץ, and the letter ח arched throughout. The names of the sons of Haman arranged in 6 lines. A few occurances of majuscular and minuscular letters. Wooden roller (435mm high).

scriptDesc.scriptNote: Sefardi square script of the 16th to 17th century.

history.provenance: Acquisition: Acquired by the British Museum from the Rich Collection in 1825.
